sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: She's the shortest serving prime minister in the UK's recent history and the latest in a string of Conservative Party leaders to resign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Liz Truss's premiership got off to a rocky start after Queen Elizabeth, Britain's longest reigning monarch, died just two days after appointing Truss to her post.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The following events surrounding the Queen's funeral overshadowed pressing issues Truss was expected to address, like the U.K.'s cost of living and energy crises.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: She was widely criticized, even by members of her own party, over her flagship tax-cutting policies, which were seen as favoring the rich, and was blamed for the ensuing financial meltdown that sent the pound crashing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The public backlash pushed her finance minister, Kwasi Kwarteng, to reverse the tax break for the highest earners and eventually to hand in his resignation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: His replacement scrapped nearly every aspect of Truss's economic plan. With most of her party turned against her and local media lambasting her leadership, Truss was forced to change her tune. A day after claiming she was a fighter, not a quitter, she announced her resignation, just 44 days after taking office. We have people this winter and I will continue to do that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As Russia continues its aerial bombardment of Ukrainian cities, the United States says it has evidence that Iran is both supplying its drones and training Russian troops in Crimea. The so-called kamikaze drones from Iran are being used to create fear among the civilian population in Ukraine and weaken national morale. We can confirm that Russian military personnel based in Crimea have been piloting Iranian UAVs and using them to conduct kinetic strikes across Ukraine, including in strikes against Kiev in recent days. We assess that Iranian personnel, Iranian military personnel, were on the ground in Crimea and assisted Russia in these operations. Russia has received dozens of these UAVs so far and will likely continue to receive additional shipments in the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: France has repatriated 40 French children and 15 French women from displacement camps in

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: northeastern Syria on Thursday. The women and children are part of a large group of French and European nationals held in northeastern Syria since 2019. That is when the so-called Islamic State fell in the region. The women are believed to have had ties with a terrorist organization having traveled to Iraq and Syria when the group was still in control of territory there. Some 11,000 foreign women and children are still believed to be held in camps across the area and according to international human rights organizations they are wasting away faced with an increased risk of violence and a fast-spreading cholera outbreak.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: France had been reluctant to bring back its nationals, citing security concerns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Late last month, the European Court for Human Rights condemned the position of the country, saying that France should review the cases of at least three of its nationals, who are believed to be among the group repatriated this week. This is the third such operation organized by French authorities this year, bringing the number of children repatriated so far in 2022 to 117. But some 100 French nationals are believed to remain in northeastern Syria. Annelies Borges in Paris for Euronews.
